intro: Macrolobium lebrunii, commonly known as the lebrunii macrolobium, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and produces woody capsules as its fruit. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forested areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
